modules.description: Provides conversion between a custom `t` type and a `defns` structure, enabling serialization and deserialization. Operates on structured data representing host definitions, preserving configuration details. Used to transform host configurations for storage or transmission.

Converts between a custom `t` type and a `defns` structure, enabling storage and transmission of host configurations. Supports structured data manipulation, allowing preservation of detailed host definitions during transformation. Operations include serializing configurations into a storable format and reconstructing them accurately. Example tasks include saving host setups to files and reloading them with full fidelity.

type t = { ino : int; name : string; typ : char } Provides functions to read directory entries, extract inode numbers, file names, and type indicators. Operates on directory entries returned by system calls, filtering and inspecting file metadata. Used to process directory contents in low-level file system operations and custom file explorers.

type t = { ip : string; port : int; name : string } Provides functions to parse host strings into structured representations, extract IP and port values, and format host information for logging. Operates on string inputs and the t record type to handle network endpoint data. Used to validate user-provided host configurations and generate consistent output for network communication.

Provides functions to parse and manipulate directory entry data from Unix system calls, working with byte sequences and custom record types representing file names and metadata. Extracts file type information and name strings from raw directory entries. Used to process directory contents in low-level file system operations and custom file browsing implementations.

manages directory and host data through structured conversions and inspections, offering tools to serialize, parse, and manipulate metadata. it handles two primary data types: one representing directory entries with inode, name, and type, and another encoding host information with IP, port, and name. it enables tasks such as saving and reloading host configurations, extracting file metadata from directory listings, and parsing network endpoints from strings. operations include serialization, parsing, filtering, and formatting of structured data for system and network use.
